sections.title: Description
code:
for i : 1 .. n - 1
            drawline (x (i), y(i), x (i + 1), y (i + 1), Color)
        end for
        drawline (x (n), y (n), x (1), y (1), Color)
sections.raw_content: The drawpolygon procedure is used to draw a polygon with n points. A line is drawn in Color from the point (x(1), y(1)) to (x(2), y(2)) to (x(3), y(3)) and so on. sections.title: Example
sections.raw_content: This program will create an octagon and display it in color 1.
sections.mdown_content: This program will create an octagon and display it in color 1.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The IBM PC limits drawpolygon to a maximum of 256 points.

The meaning of the Color number depends on the current palette. See the palette statement.

The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. See the setscreen procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode.
sections.mdown_content:
The IBM PC limits **drawpolygon** to a maximum of 256 points.
The meaning of the *Color* number depends on the current palette. See the **palette** statement.

The screen should be in a "*graphics*" mode. See the **setscreen** procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "*graphics*" mode, it will automatically be set to "*graphics*" mode.
